buildings.name: Army Camp
buildings.info: Your troops are stationed in Army Camps. Build more camps and upgrade them to muster a powerful army.

buildings.name: Town Hall
buildings.info:
This is the heart of your Village! Upgrade your Town Hall to unlock new Defenses, Buildings, Traps, and much more.

Destroying an opponent's Town Hall earns you one star in battle. Protect your Town Hall from attacks by placing it in the middle of your Village and surrounding it with Walls, Traps and Defenses.

buildings.name: Elixir Collector
buildings.info: Elixir is pumped from Ley Lines coursing underneath your Village. Upgrade your Elixir Collectors to maximize Elixir production.

buildings.name: Elixir Storage
buildings.info: These storages contain the elixir pumped from underground. Upgrade them to increase the maximum amount of elixir you can store.

buildings.name: Gold Mine
buildings.info: The Gold Mine produces Gold. Upgrade it to boost its production and Gold Storage capacity.

buildings.name: Gold Storage
buildings.info: All your precious Gold is stored here. Don't let sneaky Goblins anywhere near! Upgrade the Storage to increase its capacity and durability against attack.

buildings.name: Barracks
buildings.info: The Barracks allow you to train troops to attack your enemies. Upgrade the Barracks to unlock advanced units that can win epic battles.

buildings.name: Laboratory
buildings.info: What dark secrets do these Wizards hide inside their Laboratory? Nobody has dared to look. All we know is that their research makes our Spells and Troops harder, better, faster and stronger!

buildings.name: Cannon
buildings.info: Cannons are great for point defense. Upgrade Cannons to increase their firepower, but beware that your Defenses cannot shoot while being upgraded!

buildings.name: Archer Tower
buildings.info: Archer Towers have longer range than Cannons, and unlike Cannons they can attack flying enemies.

buildings.name: Wall
buildings.info: Walls are great for keeping your Village safe and your enemies in the line of fire.

buildings.name: Wizard Tower
buildings.info: The Ultimate Arcane Defense! Tower Wizards cast powerful area effect Spells that target both flying and ground Troops.

buildings.name: Air Defense
buildings.info: This anti-air tower is deadly against flying enemies, but can't target foes on the ground. Place it wisely to cover as much airspace as possible.

buildings.name: Mortar
buildings.info: The Mortar can mow down hordes of enemies by the splash damage from its shell. Don't let enemies get too close to it!

buildings.name: Clan Castle
buildings.info: The Clan Castle houses your Treasury and any reinforcement troops or Spells sent by your clanmates.

buildings.name: Builder's Hut
buildings.info: Nothing gets done around here without Builders! You can hire more builders to start multiple construction projects, or speed up their work by using green gems.

buildings.name: Hidden Tesla
buildings.info: Lay a deadly trap with the Hidden Tesla! Our Wizards have trapped a storm cloud into each of these sneaky towers. When an enemy walks or flies close enough, the tower springs up and fries it using the power of Electrickery!

buildings.name: Spell Factory
buildings.info: The Spell Factory is home to veteran Wizards who are better suited to creating magical weapons than front-line combat. Use their powerful Attack Spells to turn the tide of battle in your favor!

buildings.name: X-Bow
buildings.info: The X-Bow shoots mystical bolts with terrifying power. Load it with Elixir and the X-Bow works automagically. You can set it to target ground units at long ranges, or all targets at reduced range.

buildings.name: Dark Elixir Drill
buildings.info: Our Builders have finally figured a way to extract pure Dark Elixir, the rarest form of the magical substance.

buildings.name: Dark Elixir Storage
buildings.info: The power of Dark Elixir could not be contained in a regularly shaped Elixir vat. As it's three times as powerful, we had to invent a cubical form of storage!

buildings.name: Dark Barracks
buildings.info: The Dark Barracks will open doors for creatures born out of Dark Elixir. Upgrade the Barracks to unlock more Troops with unique battle skills.

buildings.name: Inferno Tower
buildings.info: Set the Inferno Tower's Dark Elixir fueled flame to build up unbelievable damage to single targets, or to constantly roast multiple targets at once.

buildings.name: Air Sweeper
buildings.info: Air Sweepers control the sky with strong blasts of air that push back flying enemies. Air Sweepers can only face one direction, so rotate them to maximize their effectiveness.

buildings.name: Dark Spell Factory
buildings.info: Only the most brilliant or reckless Master Wizards dabble in Dark Elixir brewery. Their compact Dark Spells require keen insight to master, but provide unique tactical advantages.

buildings.name: Eagle Artillery
buildings.info: The Eagle Artillery has nearly unlimited range and targets tough enemies with exploding shells. However, it won't activate until a large amount of troops have been deployed.

buildings.name: Bomb Tower
buildings.info: Bomb Towers bombard nearby ground troops and go up in a big BOOM when destroyed! Melee units best stand clear!

buildings.name: Wall
buildings.info: Walls are great for keeping your Village safe and your enemies in the line of fire.

buildings.name: Builder Hall
buildings.info:
Home of the Master Builder and the main objective in battle.

Destroying a Builder Hall awards a Star in attacks. Destroying 50% of buildings in a stage gains you a second Star, while 100% destruction awards three Stars for the stage.

Upgrade the Builder Hall to unlock advanced buildings and troops!

buildings.name: Elixir Collector
buildings.info: Elixir is pumped from Ley Lines coursing underneath your Village. Upgrade your Elixir Collectors to maximize Elixir production.

buildings.name: Elixir Storage
buildings.info: These storages contain the elixir pumped from underground. Upgrade them to increase the maximum amount of elixir you can store.

buildings.name: Gold Mine
buildings.info: The Gold Mine produces Gold. Upgrade it to boost its production and Gold Storage capacity.

buildings.name: Gold Storage
buildings.info: All your precious Gold is stored here. Don't let sneaky Goblins anywhere near! Upgrade the Storage to increase its capacity and durability against attack.

buildings.name: Clock Tower
buildings.info: The Clock Tower makes things happen faster in your Village! Collect resources, research and build faster.

buildings.name: Builder Barracks
buildings.info: The Builder Barracks trains troops for Builder Battles! You can also quickly swap troops immediately before attacking. Upgrade the Builder Barracks to unlock more troop types!

buildings.name: Double Cannon
buildings.info: Double Cannons, double shots per Cannon, It's a double-double dose of trouble!

buildings.name: Army Camp
buildings.info: Your troops are stationed in Army Camps. Each camp can house only one troop type at a time. Some troops can be upgraded to fit more units per camp!

buildings.name: Hidden Tesla
buildings.info: Part tower, part trap, completely shocking! Zap air and ground foes alike with the power of science!

buildings.name: Cannon
buildings.info: The iconic ground defense, built to last! This classic makes the Master Builder a bit sentimental.

buildings.name: Multi Mortar
buildings.info: Fires long range splash damage multiple times to maximize chances of hitting its target!

buildings.name: Star Laboratory
buildings.info: The Star Laboratory searches the heavens for secrets to unlock a troop's full potential. Improve troop hitpoints, damage and housing space in addition to special troop abilities!

buildings.name: Master Builder's Hut
buildings.info: Nothing gets done around here without the Master Builder! You can speed up his work by using green gems.

buildings.name: Archer Tower
buildings.info: No foe can escape the Archer's arrows. This tower has a special switch - choose long range or fast attack!

buildings.name: Reinforcement Camp
buildings.info: Reinforcement Camps provide helpful reinforcements during battles when reaching the corresponding stage.

buildings.name: Firecrackers
buildings.info: Keep flying pests away with flurries of small rockets! It's like a bug zapper, but prettier.

buildings.name: Guard Post
buildings.info: Houses troops to aid in defense! These rabble rousers are sure to slow down the enemy.

buildings.name: Mega Tesla
buildings.info: What happens when a Tesla goes Mega? Its powerful jolt deals heavy damage to even the toughest units!

buildings.name: Battle Machine
buildings.info: This massive machine broke attempting to hoist the realm's biggest hammer. With some repairs, it could be taken into battle!

buildings.name: Air Bombs
buildings.info: For heavyweight air defense, Air Bombs do the trick. An endless supply of explosive barrels launch into the sky to ravage flying enemies!

buildings.name: Crusher
buildings.info: The Crusher REALLY likes its personal space. This hulking stone slams ground units with a mighty wallop!

buildings.name: Roaster
buildings.info: Bathe foes with a fiery flood of scalding plasma! Both air and ground troops will feel the burn!

buildings.name: Giant Cannon
buildings.info: Nothing gets in the way of the Giant Cannon. Its mammoth-sized cannon balls push past anything and just keep going and going and going...

buildings.name: Gem Mine
buildings.info: Gem Mines access a rare deposit of this highly valuable resource! Mining Gems is slow and hard work.

buildings.name: Workshop
buildings.info: The Workshop is where Siege Machines are built. Upgrade the Workshop to unlock different Siege Machines!

buildings.name: Lava Launcher
buildings.info: Hurls molten rock over great distances. Sets the ground on fire, which really turns up the heat for enemy ground troops!

buildings.name: B.O.B's Hut
buildings.info: B.O.B, a totally normal Builder, lives here among us. Definitely not a robot controlled from the Builder Base.

buildings.name: B.O.B Control
buildings.info: Control center for Master Builder's latest invention! Once fully upgraded, B.O.B becomes an additional builder in the Home Village!

buildings.name: Scattershot
buildings.info: The Scattershot heaves very heavy bundles of poorly tied together rocks at whoever happens to be closest. The bundles break apart on impact and deal additional damage to the troops behind.

buildings.name: Pet House
buildings.info: Every Hero deserves a loyal companion. The Pet House allows you to unlock powerful Pets with various abilities to fight alongside your Heroes.

buildings.name: Blacksmith
buildings.info: Bring the right magical Ores here and your Heroes' Equipment can be upgraded to be even mightier! The smoke from the furnace helps make delicious, if unhealthy, brisket.

buildings.name: Hero Hall
buildings.info: This fancy Hall honors your Village's mightiest warriors! Visit the Hero Hall for all your heroic essentials, and to upgrade Heroes. Upgrade the Hero Hall to unlock more Heroes!

buildings.name: Spell Tower
buildings.info: For years, Wizards alone brought magic to the battlefield one fireball at a time. Now they've developed a fully automated way to give your village more ways to mess up attackers with magic!

buildings.name: Monolith
buildings.info: The Builder's first experiment in using Dark Elixir for a building resulted in something truly frightful. The stronger the Monolith's target, the more damage it does. Great to have defending your Village, but a little scary to attack against.

buildings.name: O.T.T.O's Outpost
buildings.info: O.T.T.O´s home and the main building of the second stage. May contain additional feisty robots.\n\nDestroying O.T.T.O´s Outpost awards an extra star in attacks.

buildings.name: Multi-Gear Tower
buildings.info: The Multi-Gear Tower is a powerful combination of two classic Defenses! Choose the attack mode that suits you and let the destruction begin! Targets air and ground units.

buildings.name: Battle Copter
buildings.info: Get to the Copter! Tired of hammering through Walls, Master Builder's next-generation flying machine lets him soar over them. The Battle Copter attacks from afar with its powerful Cannons; or can get up close and personal when using its Bomb Rush ability.

buildings.name: X-Bow
buildings.info: The X-Bow shoots powerful bolts with terrifying power. You can set it to target ground units or air units.

buildings.name: Healing Hut
buildings.info: Brews up a hearty and nourishing cauldron of soup following Master Builder's grandma's recipe. Troops eat some on their way to the next stage of an attack, recovering some of their health.

buildings.name: Sour Elixir Cauldron
buildings.info: This haunted creation by the strangely behaving Builder transforms your regular Elixir Storages into Sour Elixir. Hopefully this is just temporary.

buildings.name: Multi-Archer Tower
buildings.info: These Archers have teamed up to take out attackers faster and more furiously than ever. Teamwork makes the dream work!

buildings.name: Ricochet Cannon
buildings.info: Builder has used one weird trick to develop a devastating cannonball that will ricochet and hit a second target.

buildings.name: Firespitter
buildings.info: The Firespitter spews flames at a fire rate faster than the X-Bow! If it misses, the Firespitter will shoot past its target to deal damage to enemies behind. It can only face a single direction, so place carefully!

buildings.name: Helper Hut
buildings.info: Helpers rest up on a warm bunk bed in this cozy little hut! Visit the Helper Hut and assign Helpers to jobs around the Village.

buildings.name: Crafting Station
buildings.info: Build Crafted Defenses and upgrade their stats however you like! Crafted Defenses last until a Crafting Phase ends. New Defenses will take their place with the next phase! Experiment with new Defenses and you might just find a new favorite!

seasonal_defenses.name: Hook Tower
seasonal_defenses.info: The Master Builder won’t mind that we borrowed rope from his boat, will he?\n\nThe Hook Tower pulls in enemies from afar and stuns them. Sadly, Siege Machines are a bit too heavy!

seasonal_defenses.name: Sun Beam
seasonal_defenses.info: Sun Beam has long range and its damage depends on distance to the target.

seasonal_defenses.name: Flame Spinner
seasonal_defenses.info: Fear the relentless rotating of a repurposed cooking oven!\n\nWithout ever getting dizzy, the Flame Spinner creates an endless whirlwind of fire that damages nearby ground and air enemies.

seasonal_defenses.name: Crusher Mortar
seasonal_defenses.info: Bowlers from all around line up to get this thing’s autograph! The Crusher Mortar’s spiky boulders land with the grace of Golems, before bouncing around for extra collateral damage. Protective headwear is recommended!

seasonal_defenses.name: Lazy Laser
seasonal_defenses.info: Long range laser which initially does very small damage but over time the damage ramps up to be very high.

traps.name: Bomb
traps.info: Nothing says 'STAY OUT' quite like a good old-fashioned hidden bomb.

traps.name: Spring Trap
traps.info: This bouncy little number tosses an unwanted visitor right off your property!

traps.name: Giant Bomb
traps.info: When you're looking for a Big Boom, you need the Giant Bomb.

traps.name: Air Bomb
traps.info: Latest invention in the field of flying pest control. This trap can blast multiple air units in a small area.

traps.name: Seeking Air Mine
traps.info: Is it a bird? Is it a plane? Well it makes no difference as the Seeking Air Mine will blow it sky high. This trap does devastating damage to a single air unit.

traps.name: Skeleton Trap
traps.info: Ambush and distract unsuspecting foes with a surprise skirmish of short-lived, but sneaky skeleton troops! Skeleton Traps can be configured to pursue either ground or air troops.

traps.name: Spring Trap
traps.info: This bouncy little number launches a small Troop out of battle! Big Troops with higher Housing Space are pushed back and damaged.

traps.name: Push Trap
traps.info: Toss ground troops in a direction you choose. Heave ho!

traps.name: Mine
traps.info: Plan an explosive surprise for troops that get too close. Choose air or ground!

traps.name: Mega Mine
traps.info: A hidden dose of heavy destruction. Choose air or ground!

traps.name: Tornado Trap
traps.info: Wind and stones may break some bones, but this trap will definitely confound you. Just place one of these traps down and the released vortex will draw the enemy troops in, hindering their progress.

traps.name: Giga Bomb
traps.info: Villagers didn't want to keep this dangerous Weapon inside the Town Hall, so they moved it out! The Giga Bomb pushes enemies back with massive damage. This Trap is so deadly, it doesn't need to hide!

troops.name: Barbarian
troops.info: This fearless warrior relies on his bulging muscles and striking mustache to wreak havoc in enemy Villages. Release a horde of Barbarians and enjoy the mayhem!

troops.name: Archer
troops.info: These sharpshooters like to keep their distance on the battlefield and in life. Nothing makes them happier than single-mindedly taking down their target.

troops.name: Goblin
troops.info: These pesky little creatures only have eyes for one thing: LOOT! They are faster than a Spring Trap, and their hunger for resources is limitless.

troops.name: Giant
troops.info: These big guys may seem calm, but show them a Cannon or Archer Tower and you´ll see their fury unleashed! Slow yet durable, these warriors are best used to soak up hits.

troops.name: Wall Breaker
troops.info: Nothing warms a Wall Breaker's cold and undead heart like blowing up Walls. A squad of them will make way for your ground units, and they will do it with a BANG!

troops.name: Balloon
troops.info: These promoted Skeletons have traded in their joy of destroying Walls for a joy of destroying defenses. Deploy them to take out pesky Mortars and Cannons!

troops.name: Wizard
troops.info: The Wizard is a terrifying presence on the battlefield. Pair him up with some of his fellows and cast concentrated blasts of destruction on anything, land or sky!

troops.name: Healer
troops.info: This majestic creature lives to protect and aid her fellow troops. Any army is improved with her healing support, but make sure to protect her from air defenses!

troops.name: Dragon
troops.info: The might of the dragons is known throughout the land. This scaly terror of the skies feels no mercy and nothing will escape the fiery splashes of his breath.

troops.name: P.E.K.K.A
troops.info: Is P.E.K.K.A a knight? A samurai? A robot? No one knows! P.E.K.K.A´s armor absorbs even the mightiest of blows.

troops.name: Minion
troops.info: This terror of the skies was born out of Dark Elixir. Undetectable by the Seeking Air Mine, Minions materialize with ease, but are fragile in our world.

troops.name: Hog Rider
troops.info: Having tamed the fierce leaping Hog, the Hog Rider punishes those who hide behind their puny Walls! Fueled by Dark Elixir, these warriors have never known defeat!

troops.name: Valkyrie
troops.info: A master of the two-handed axe, this glorious warrior runs between nearby buildings and can shred several troops or buildings at once with her whirlwind blow!

troops.name: Golem
troops.info: The mighty Golem loves to soak up damage! When destroyed, it explodes and splits into Golemites. The resulting Golemites have one-fifth the Golem's strength and hitpoints.

troops.name: Witch
troops.info: The Witch never fights alone, constantly raising dead warriors from past battles to lead her attacks. Upgraded Witches raise more skeletons at a time.

troops.name: Lava Hound
troops.info: These fiery beasts can't resist chasing after Air Defenses, providing excellent protection for other troops. Once destroyed, they erupt into many smaller, weaker menaces.

troops.name: Bowler
troops.info: This big blue dude digs the simple things in life - Dark Elixir drinks and throwing rocks. His massive boulders bounce off of their target and hit again behind it for a double strike!

troops.name: Baby Dragon
troops.info: This fire-breathing hatchling is shy around other air units, but leave it alone and it'll throw a fit! When not around other air units, Baby Dragons become enraged and gain bonus damage and attack speed.

troops.name: Miner
troops.info: These sneaky shovelers burrow underground, pass beneath Walls and pop up right next to their targets. While underground, Miners cannot be damaged and will not trigger Traps, but still gain bonuses from Spells.

troops.name: Super Barbarian
troops.info: Superior in health, power, speed and most importantly, hair, the Super Barbarians are what regular Barbarians dream of becoming!

troops.name: Super Archer
troops.info: Having achieved serious arm strength, the Super Archer can now threaten targets several buildings away.

troops.name: Super Wall Breaker
troops.info: Who knew that rolling was that much superior to running? Super Wall Breakers use pre-ignited bombs that blow up under all circumstances! No more duds!

troops.name: Super Giant
troops.info: Super Giants are bigger than their ordinary cousins and are great at punching their way through walls. The belt is from the annual Village eating contest.

troops.name: Ice Wizard
troops.info: This Legendary wizard slows down enemy defenses with destructive shards of ice!\n\nOnly available for a limited time.

troops.name: Raged Barbarian
troops.info: Why is he so angry, speedy and vicious? Nobody's brave enough to ask. Maybe it's because he can't find his sword?

troops.name: Sneaky Archer
troops.info: Cloaked under cover of moonlight, Archers can take out targets before ever being seen. Their weakness? Overconfidence.

troops.name: Beta Minion
troops.info: Attacks targets from a distance, glows in the dark, and is a maniac on the dance floor.

troops.name: Boxer Giant
troops.info: Heavy-handed and built like an ox, these Giants have been practicing their haymaker punch!

troops.name: Bomber
troops.info: With an appetite for destruction and high quality special effects, Bombers blow up anything in sight with bonus damage to Walls!

troops.name: Power P.E.K.K.A
troops.info: Unstable energy radiates from this powerful suit of dark armor, waiting to be unleashed!

troops.name: Cannon Cart
troops.info: A Cannon on wheels?! Wait, did it just turn into a Mortar?? Bet they won´t see that coming! Both powerful and versatile!

troops.name: Drop Ship
troops.info: Packed to the brim with bones instead of bombs, Skeletons leap out of these balloons directly next to the enemy!

troops.name: Baby Dragon
troops.info: Cute, snuggly and prone to fire-spitting tantrums. Rampant destruction has never been so adorable.

troops.name: Night Witch
troops.info: Fearlessly summons flocks of flying creatures and, unlike her sister, leaves the grass in pristine condition.

troops.name: Battle Ram
troops.info: Four Barbarians holding a big log race ahead to batter down their target, dealing big bonus damage if they connect; then they fight on with their swords!

troops.name: Royal Ghost
troops.info: Upset that no one notices him, the Royal Ghost is determined to smash things up until he gets the recognition he deserves. He's so unnoticeable that even Walls won't hold him back!

troops.name: Pumpkin Barbarian
troops.info: Who would've thought that pumpkins make for good makeshift armor? The pumpkin helmets provide these regular Barbarians some extra hitpoints until they get destroyed.

troops.name: Giant Skeleton
troops.info: Big boned from early age, the Giant Skeleton was always destined to blow up more than just Walls. His massive bomb damages everything around him after he is destroyed.

troops.name: Wall Wrecker
troops.info: The Wall Wrecker exists for two simple purposes: to smash through anything that it comes across and to deliver the Clan Castle Troops straight to the heart of the Village. Built from heavy duty materials, it can take a pummeling before breaking down. Immune to Spell effects.

troops.name: Battle Blimp
troops.info: The Battle Blimp bypasses ground-based obstacles and delivers your Clan Castle troops directly into the heart of the enemy Village, all while dropping bombs along the way. However, its thin hide makes it easier to shoot down. Immune to Spell effects.

troops.name: Yeti
troops.info: This heavy-hitting furry fellow digs cold weather and his Yetimite buddies. Hurt him, and you'll make the Yetimites real angry.

troops.name: Sneaky Goblin
troops.info: Sneaky Goblins have a talent going unnoticed for a while after being deployed. It's usually the incredibly loud sound of resources being pilfered that gives them away.

troops.name: Super Miner
troops.info: Armed with a powerful drill and a magnificent moustache, Super Miner is ready to undermine any rival Village!

troops.name: Rocket Balloon
troops.info: Retrofitted with two carefully safety-inspected booster rockets, the Rocket Balloon gets a flying start to every battle!

troops.name: Ice Golem
troops.info: The Ice Golem has a chilling personality and absolutely zero sense of humour. He frosts over everything he touches, freezes his surroundings when destroyed and ices up when talked to at a party. On defense his freeze effect is smaller and has a shorter duration.

troops.name: Electro Dragon
troops.info: Possessing iron-tough scales and a breath of devastating lightning, the Electro Dragon's favorite thing is raining destruction from above. When vanquished, the Electro Dragon even pummels the ground with lightning strikes!

troops.name: Skeleton Barrel
troops.info: Is it a bird? Is it a plane? No, just Harry, Larry, Terry and a dozen friends, heading for the nearest building in a barrel of bones!

troops.name: Stone Slammer
troops.info: The Stone Slammer is a heavy-duty, flying mountain that targets defensive buildings by flattening them with giant boulders and causes earthquakes. Immune to spell effects.

troops.name: Inferno Dragon
troops.info: Not getting upset over being alone anymore, the Inferno Dragon has learned to focus its rage into a very powerful beam that builds up over time!

troops.name: Super Valkyrie
troops.info: Not only are Super Valkyries superior to regular Valkyries in every way, they're also way more angry!

troops.name: Dragon Rider
troops.info: This aerial engine of destruction readily and frankly, quite excitedly lays waste to any defense it comes across. The skeleton onboard swears he's not touching the controls.

troops.name: Super Witch
troops.info: Focused magic creates focused results. Instead of summoning hordes of tiny skeletons, Super Witch summons just one really big skeleton with very formidable bone density.

troops.name: M.E.C.H.A
troops.info: Is M.E.C.H.A a knight? A samurai? A robot? YES! M.E.C.H.A easily smashes through Walls in the way between her and the next Defense!

troops.name: Hog Glider
troops.info: The real riders in the sky. They have a great track record in getting over Walls, but are not very good at avoiding crashes.

troops.name: Party Wizard
troops.info: The distant echo of a kick snare or high hat can only mean one thing; the Party Wizard is making his grand entrance. Dropping phat beats and massive fireballs, he's the soul of post-battle celebrations.

troops.name: Siege Barracks
troops.info: The Siege Barracks parachutes down gracefully to first release a menagerie of P.E.K.K.As and Wizards and then the Clan Castle troops. How they all managed to squeeze inside is a mystery not really worth investigating.

troops.name: Ice Hound
troops.info: Free from all that lava-induced indigestion, the Ice Hound is ready to freeze the flow of battle. Chill out, or else.

troops.name: Super Bowler
troops.info: Super Bowler now has everything he's ever wanted: a grippier glove, more comfortable footwear, and even more ridiculously massive boulders to toss.

troops.name: Super Dragon
troops.info: Sometimes having a fire inside of you isn't enough. The Super Dragon has fires on the inside, outside, and if he gets to do his thing, all around him!

troops.name: Headhunter
troops.info: Headhunter has just one job: taking out enemy Heroes. At her other job, she works at the Village Apothecary. She's lightweight enough to jump over Walls and her Poisoned Weapons make her targets move and attack slower.

troops.name: Super Wizard
troops.info: Super Wizard is positively charged with magical energy! He's either the smartest person in the room... or else he blows the whole room to bits.

troops.name: Super Minion
troops.info: Super Minion's big forehead isn't just for show: sniping enemy defenses from a safe distance is simply a brainy move! Especially when you've grown too big to avoid Seeking Air Mines.

troops.name: Log Launcher
troops.info: While Log Launcher certainly isn't the fastest or the sturdiest, it is definitely among the meanest. This trunk-throwing contraption pummels everything in front of it with endless logs to open up a path to the enemy Town Hall. Immune to spell effects.

troops.name: Flame Flinger
troops.info: This little charmer flings bundles of Fire Spirits that both hit hard and leave behind a burning mess. Its long range helps it stay out of trouble, but beware of longer range defenses and traps! Immune to spell effects.

troops.name: Battle Drill
troops.info: A fine example of goblin ingenuity, the Battle Drill burrows underground towards the nearest defense. On arrival it pops up to stun and demolish with its dastardly drill.

troops.name: Ram Rider
troops.info: She may not know the RAMifications of defeat as this Gingerbread Ram Rider is one tough cookie. This dessert duo is the best combination since Oreo and Juliet and makes Walls crumble like overbaked biscuits.

troops.name: Electro Titan
troops.info: Barely controlling her raw magical power, the Electro Titan is a formidable force on the battlefield. She channels some of her magic into a powerful electro whip while the rest spills out to damage everything around her.

troops.name: Apprentice Warden
troops.info: Despite his grand ambitions, Apprentice Warden is still just a student. Supports Troops with his magical Life Aura and less-magical slingshot.

troops.name: Super Hog Rider
troops.info: This dangerous duo of Hog and Rider are even more superb now. They ride together, they split up and keep fighting together.

troops.name: Barcher
troops.info: Combining the fierce toughness of a Barbarian with the tough fierceness of an Archer, the Barcher is a surprisingly effective attacker given its unhealthy appearance.

troops.name: Witch Golem
troops.info: With the rock-hard determination of a Golem and the dark magics of a Witch, this monstrous mashup makes short work of enemy defenses!

troops.name: Hog Wizard
troops.info: This dangerous duo merges the fiery attitude and magic of a Wizard with the relentless mobility of a Hog Rider. Opponents will shake in their boots at the sound of this pair approaching!

troops.name: Lavaloon
troops.info: Blending the powerfully blasty bombs of a Balloon with the rock-hard armour of a Lava Hound, the Lavaloon brings a base to ruin one boom at a time.

troops.name: Electrofire Wizard
troops.info: Master of Magic, Sorceror of Style, the Electrofire Wizard incinerates single targets or zaps multiple foes with charged electricity.

troops.name: Root Rider
troops.info: This earth warrior is so in tune with nature she doesn't need to walk herself. Riding into battle atop a tough tree root, Root Rider can smash through Walls and slam Defenses into dust.

troops.name: C.O.O.K.I.E
troops.info: C.O.O.K.I.E doesn't just sweeten the battlefield with fierce fighting, this baked battler goes in armed with a pirouetting pretzel attack, dealing splash damage. It may leave devastation in its wake, but that's the way the cookie crumbles.

troops.name: Firecracker
troops.info: This pink-haired pyromaniac traded her Archer's bow for something with more firepower. Firecracker is always looking to fling her flamboyant fulminations at the nearest target; however, the recoil from her attacks sends her slightly backwards. She may be responsible for colorful and explosive displays during Lunar New Year, just don't leave anything flammable in her proximity.

troops.name: Azure Dragon
troops.info: The Year of the Azure Dragon represents strength and power, and this majestic wyrm embodies both. As a harbinger of spring and the coming rainfall, may Azure Dragon rain victory upon your battlefield. With its high hit points and piercing splash projectile that also deals damage behind its initial target, this mighty unit will definitely make sure your battles don't... drag on.

troops.name: Barbarian Kicker
troops.info: Starts the match with a calm, carefully aimed shot that smashes the nearest Defense. Then goes on the usual Barbarian rampage.

troops.name: Giant Thrower
troops.info: This big budding sportsman throws a heavy bouncing ball at the nearest Building. Then he moves on to the typical Giant smashing!

troops.name: Druid
troops.info: The Druid has complicated emotions. One moment he's calmly helping heal his fellow Troops, and the next he's turned into a very angry Bear.

troops.name: Broom Witch
troops.info: A trainee Witch who flies around the battlefield delivering Witch Spirits. She particularly dislikes snooty Wizards atop fancy towers.

troops.name: Ice Minion
troops.info: Mixing the ferociousness of a Minion with the freeziness of an Ice Golem, the Ice Minion targets and slows down Defenses. Like a snowflake, it's fragile!

troops.name: Thrower
troops.info: This powerful pitcher has his eye on the prize! The Thrower hurls mighty spears from long range at enemies and Defenses. His secret? The strength lies in his fabulous facial hair!

troops.name: Troop Launcher
troops.info: This immobile machine launches barrel loads of Troops and Clan Castle Troops at your allies in battle to support them. Each barrel can hold multiple Troops, including one Clan Castle Troop. There's only a few barrels inside, so make them count!

troops.name: Debt Collector
troops.info: Greedy fingers! The Debt Collector targets resource Buildings and loots way more than a regular Goblin. Additional Loot is not taken from the Defender. Instead, it is generated by the Debt Collector himself!

troops.name: Snake Barrel
troops.info: This Lunar New Year, it’s raining snakes! These green menaces are barrels of fun, and bite chunks out of Defenses. They’ll slither over Walls, and are effective in groups!

troops.name: Super Yeti
troops.info: This mysterious masked Yeti is charged up! His electrical little buddies spring into action when he takes damage and zap the closest Building to spark a devastating chain reaction!

troops.name: Furnace
troops.info: The Furnace doesn’t move, but it does spawn Firemites over time that target Buildings. These curious little guys leave pools of fire where they visit!

troops.name: Giant Giant
troops.info: With the might of 10 Giants, the Giant Giant clobbers Defenses with massive splash damage. Uh-oh! If he loses half of his max health, he’ll rage out with increased speed and power.

troops.name: K.A.N.E
troops.info: This tough Troop does what he wants! K.A.N.E. sees red, and goes straight for the Town Hall! He pummels ground and air units that get in his way with splash-damaging slams. When defeated, he is reborn in flames with increased damage and a fierce fiery aura.

troops.name: The Disarmer
troops.info: She is THE MAN! The Disarmer targets Defenses with spiteful blows of her bat and makes easy work of Walls by jumping right over them! She must be put down 3 times before she’s out. Talk about tough!

troops.name: YEETer
troops.info: With huge range, YEETer hurls 4 loyal tribe members at the start of battle that attack everything, before going back to his trusty spears. Say it loud now, YEET!

troops.name: YEETer
troops.info: With huge range, YEETer hurls 4 loyal tribe members at the start of battle that attack everything, before going back to his trusty spears. Say it loud now, YEET!

troops.name: The Disarmer
troops.info: She is THE MAN! The Disarmer targets Defenses with spiteful blows of her bat and makes easy work of Walls by jumping right over them! She must be put down 3 times before she’s out. Talk about tough!

troops.name: Meteor Golem
troops.info: From the cosmos, to your army! This lob-loving duo will throw themselves at anything for up-close damage. When separated, Meteormites will attack nearby targets or find a friend to form a Meteor Golem!

spells.name: Lightning Spell
spells.info: Electrocute your enemies with a bolt of lightning!\n\nCast this Spell at the enemy Village to damage and stun Buildings and units inside a small area.

spells.name: Healing Spell
spells.info: Heal your Troops to keep them in the fight!\n\nCast this Spell to create a Ring of Healing. Your units will be healed while they are inside this ring.

spells.name: Rage Spell
spells.info: Enrage your units to make them bigger, faster and stronger!\n\nCast this to create a Ring of Rage! Your units will gain speed and attack power while they are inside this ring.

spells.name: Jump Spell
spells.info: Walls slowing you down? Try making a shortcut!\n\nCast this Spell near enemy Walls to create a route straight over them. Your Troops will jump over affected wall pieces as if they weren't even there!

spells.name: Freeze Spell
spells.info: When the going gets hot, stay frosty!\n\nThe Freeze Spell sends out a cryogenic blast that temporarily immobilizes enemy troops and disables defensive buildings within its radius.

spells.name: Santa's Surprise
spells.info: Ask Santa for the best present there is: a hail of destruction raining down on your enemies!

spells.name: Poison Spell
spells.info: Give your army the upper hand against enemy troops with this deadly poison!\n\nDefending units that linger in a Poison Spell's toxic cloud will move slower, attack slower and take damage with increasing severity over time. Poison Spells do not affect structures.

spells.name: Earthquake Spell
spells.info: Weaken Walls and Buildings with crippling earthquakes!\n\nEarthquake Spells damage structures based on their maximum hitpoints. Repeated earthquakes deal decreasing damage to the same Buildings, but increasing damage to the same Walls. No Wall can withstand the might of four Earthquake Spells!

spells.name: Haste Spell
spells.info: Put some hustle in even your heaviest units!\n\nHaste Spells lack the damage boost of Rage Spells, but provide an even better boost to movement speed. A lower storage space also allows you to take more of them into battle!

spells.name: Clone Spell
spells.info: Turn this Spell into a pop-up army!\n\nClone Spells create a circle of spawning that creates limited-lifetime copies of troops that enter it. It will only spawn up to a maximum housing space of troops.

spells.name: Skeleton Spell
spells.info: Summon an army of Skeletons anywhere on the battlefield!\n\nPut a few extra swords when and where you need them most. Skeletons do not trigger traps.

spells.name: Bat Spell
spells.info: Summon an army of Bats anywhere on the battlefield!\n\nDeploy aerial reinforcements wherever you need them the most. Bats do not trigger traps.

spells.name: Invisibility Spell
spells.info: Invisibility Spell makes EVERYTHING except for Walls and Siege Machines invisible and untargetable within its radius.

spells.name: Recall Spell
spells.info: Attack going badly? Need to come in from another direction? The Recall Spell summons back Troops, Heroes and Pets to the deployment bar. You can then send the recalled units back out for a second strike.

spells.name: Overgrowth Spell
spells.info: Ever wish you could ignore a whole chunk of that enemy base? The Overgrowth Spell traps nearby Buildings in tough roots, stopping Defenses attacking. Troops ignore trapped Buildings.

spells.name: Bag of Frostmites
spells.info: Briefly freezes the target area and slowly summons bouncing Frostmites which slow down and distract the nearby defenses.

spells.name: Revive Spell
spells.info: The Healer's own special recipe! The Revive Spell brings a defeated Hero in its range back into the fight with some health. Bring this Spell into battle, and a floating golden heart will appear above any defeated Hero that can be revived. Upgrade the Revive Spell to increase the amount of health Heroes regain.

spells.name: Ice Block Spell
spells.info: A brrr-illiant defensive strategy!\n\nCast this cool concoction to encase your ground and air Troops in ice that blocks almost all damage but freezes their movement and attack!

heroes.name: Barbarian King
heroes.info: Biggest and bravest of all barbarians, this colossal menace soaks up huge amounts of damage and smashes anything in his path with his sword. He guards his territory fiercely when defending.

heroes.name: Archer Queen
heroes.info: Towering above all other Archers, this graceful huntress is a master of destructive force. Although her health is modest, she snipes targets from afar with her powerful X-bow. As a defender she guards the Village with a vengeance.

heroes.name: Grand Warden
heroes.info: This powerful master of magic supports Troops by blasting enemies with his Staff! The Grand Warden can even walk or fly over Walls! He’ll make a majestic stand at his Hero Banner when defending.

heroes.name: Battle Machine
heroes.info: The Master Builder's prize invention smashes enemy buildings to bits. What better way is there to show who's the best builder around? Unlock the Electric Hammer ability to give opponents a real pounding!

heroes.name: Royal Champion
heroes.info: Over the Wall and at them! The Royal Champion is only afraid of four things, and the enemy isn't one of them. Her short range is perfect for stabbing defenses up close and personal.

heroes.name: Battle Copter
heroes.info: Get to the Copter! Tired of hammering through Walls, Master Builder's next-generation flying machine lets him soar over them. The Battle Copter attacks from afar with its powerful Cannons; or can get up close and personal when using its Bomb Rush ability.

heroes.name: Minion Prince
heroes.info: This self-proclaimed Prince of Darkness means business! The Minion Prince takes to the skies and damages targets with dark magic! When defending, he can only be attacked by ranged and air units.

pets.name: L.A.S.S.I
pets.info: The trustiest hound to ever roam the village proper, L.A.S.S.I chases enemies with unrelenting fury. Unless they fly, in which case she just observes them intently.

pets.name: Mighty Yak
pets.info: Built like a Siege Machine, the Mighty Yak has a knack for knocking down any Walls it comes in contact with. It also flies into a rage if you knock out its companion.

pets.name: Electro Owl
pets.info: Electro Owl zaps enemy Defenses into dust from great distance. He's mostly made of feathers though, so better keep him well protected!

pets.name: Unicorn
pets.info: Unicorns have severe trust issues, but overcoming them with love and patience is totally worth it. They'll heal up any minor or major scrapes as well as any Healer!

pets.name: Phoenix
pets.info: A true friend will egg you on when things get rough. Phoenix starts the battle as a helpless egg, but at the moment her Hero might go down, she hatches. The furious fiery fowl then gives temporary invulnerability to its Hero and engages nearby enemies.

pets.name: Poison Lizard
pets.info: Always the fastest never the lastest, Poison Lizard spits slowing toxins at its foes. Is it actually a venom lizard? Possibly, but who's brave enough to correct it?

pets.name: Diggy
pets.info: Diggy is an introvert and spends a lot of time hiding underground. Still when it comes to battle he'll do his part, coming up to attack Buildings and aid his Hero. If his Hero's taken out he'll seek out a new one for support and scritches.

pets.name: Frosty
pets.info: Frosty is the coolest Pet... literally. Not only does his icy breath cause enemies to chill out, but he also releases swarms of Frostmites to further slow down defenses and help his Hero.

pets.name: Spirit Fox
pets.info: An extremely shy creature, who's happiest alone in the woods outside the Village. When called to battle, Spirit Fox fights fiercely alongside their Hero and helps them with a little invisibility.

pets.name: Angry Jelly
pets.info: This blob of pure anger gets impatient waiting around the Village, it's hungry for a good fight. During Battle it convinces its Hero to attack Defenses before splitting to fight separately.

pets.name: Sneezy
pets.info: Her nose is blocked and loaded! Sneezy hangs behind her Hero due to allergies and sneezes tanky air Boogers that target Buildings. She goes on the attack when her Hero falls!
